law.text: The director shall institute an educational and publicity program, in order to inform the general public, and particularly parents of children residing in areas of significant exposure to sources of lead poisoning; teachers, social workers and other human service personnel; owners of residential property, particularly property constructed previous to the year nineteen hundred and forty-five; and health services personnel, and particularly interns, residents and other intake personnel at major hospitals, of the dangers, frequency, and sources of lead poisoning, and the methods of preventing such poisoning.
